description: Ancient DNA has revealed a genetic link between the cultures of ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia, according to research published in a journal this week

description: Egypt rejected what it called Ethiopia's "unilateral" actions over its controversial Nile dam project after Addis Ababa announced the project was complete

description: An Algerian court on Thursday sentenced a historian to five years in prison after offensive remarks he made about the native Amazigh culture

description: Doctors Without Borders warned of "mass atrocities" and "ethnically targeted violence" in Sudan's Darfur as fighting between warring sides worsens

description: Russia said on Thursday it had accepted the credentials of a new ambassador of Afghanistan, making it the first nation to recognise the Taliban government

description: Israel said it targeted an individual who worked on behalf of Iran's Quds Force in a drone strike on a busy highway south of Beirut on Thursday
title: Israeli drone strike on highway near Beirut kills 1, wounds 3

description: Khalifa compared the outrage over Bob Vylan's chant at Glastonbury to an Israeli song that called for her death.

description: Spanish steel giant Sidenor has suspended all trade with Israel following intense pressure from pro-Palestine groups.

description: Marwan al-Sultan, one of Gaza’s last remaining cardiologists and the director of the Indonesian Hospital, was killed with his family in an Israeli airstrike.

description: Iran says it remains committed to the NPT but will limit IAEA access, citing security concerns after Israeli strikes and criticism from Western nations.

description: Four Palestine Action activists were remanded after damaging UK aircraft; the government seeks to ban the group, a move rights groups are urgently contesting.

description: France condemned Iran's reported spy charges against two detained nationals as "unjustified," demanding their immediate release amid fears for their wellbeing.

description: Experts warn that temporary measures are not enough and urge international legal action against Turkey and Iran to protect Iraq's water rights.
